column1: In Python, what is a negative index?
column2: In Arrays and Lists, Python contains a unique feature called negative indexing. Python starts indexing from the beginning of an array or list in a positive integer but reads items from the ending of an array or list in a negative index.

column1: What is the Python data type SET, and how can I use it?
column2: "set" is a Python data type which is a sort of collection. Since Python 2.4, it's been a part of the language. A set is a collection of distinct and immutable items that are not in any particular sequence.

column1: How do you print the summation of all the numbers from 1 to 101?
Is Python programming language or scripting language?
column2: Although we can use Python to write scripts, it is primarily used as a general-purpose programming language.
